title: Rimmington

properties.value: Rimmington is a village in south-west Asgarnia. It is a very small village, but popular for use of the player-owned house portal and Phials for training Prayer.

Rimmington is a village in south-west Asgarnia. It is a very small village, but popular for use of the player-owned house portal and Phials for training Prayer.

Contents

  • 1 Transportation
  • 2 Stores
    • 2.1 Rimmington General Store
    • 2.2 Rommik's Crafty Supplies
    • 2.3 Brian's Archery Supplies
  • 3 Trees
  • 4 Quests
  • 5 Features
    • 5.1 Western jetty
    • 5.2 Farming patch
    • 5.3 Water source

    • 5.6 Crafting Guild
    • 5.7 House portal
    • 5.8 Banknote exchange merchant
    • 5.9 Melzar's Maze

Transportation[edit | edit source]

There are several ways to reach Rimmington:

  • Walking south from Falador, or walking west from Port Sarim.
  • Casting Teleport To House if the player-owned house is in Rimmington.
  • A skills necklace can be used to teleport to the nearby Crafting Guild.
  • The fairy ring to the south on Mudskipper Point, AIQ.
  • The ship from Corsair Cove, available after starting The Corsair Curse quest.
  • The ship from Ardougne and Brimhaven, costing 30 coins (halved by Ring of Charos (a) and completing Cabin Fever).

Stores[edit | edit source]

Rimmington General Store[edit | edit source]

Main article: Rimmington General Store

The general store () has two floors. On the main floor is the shop keeper and the shop assistant. The store rarely has anything of value in it, mainly willow logs and low level items. Since Rimmington is so far away from a bank, players rarely sell items to the store. There is nothing other than decorations on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US].

Rommik's Crafty Supplies[edit | edit source]

Main article: Rommik's Crafty Supplies

Rommik's Crafty Supplies is located south of the Rimmington General Store. Rommik sells supplies useful for crafting. His store is exactly the same as the crafting store in Al Kharid. Players can purchase chisels, ring moulds, necklace moulds, amulet moulds, needles, thread, holy moulds, and tiara moulds from him.

Brian's Archery Supplies[edit | edit source]

Main article: Brian's Archery Supplies

Brian's Archery Supplies () is located east of Rommik's store. Brian sells supplies used for ranging. His store is very similar to Lowe's Archery Emporium (located in Varrock), though is much less busy. Players can purchase steel arrows, mithril arrows, adamant arrows, oak shortbows, oak longbows, willow shortbows, willow longbows, maple shortbows, and maple longbows from him, however he doesn't sell bronze arrows because they spawn reasonably fast nearby. Two logs and a bronze arrow respawn on a nearby table in his building. There are also rats in his house which can be killed for rat's tails for the Witch's Potion quest.

Trees[edit | edit source]

Rimmington has four yew trees () north-west of the general store. Behind Brian's and Rommik's stores are many willow trees. There are also some oak trees to the east of the village. A bank is very far away, so few players cut these trees. It may be used as a place to level up Firemaking by cutting a full inventory of logs and subsequently burning them. However, there is no space to burn a full inventory of logs in a straight line, hampering training efficiency.

Quests[edit | edit source]

Rimmington is the start point of only one quest, which is free-to-play:

  • Witch's Potion starts in the small house east of Brian's Archery Supplies where Hetty lives.

Features[edit | edit source]

Western jetty[edit | edit source]

Players may travel to the Corsair Cove to talking to Cabin Boy Colin located on the north ship, after the Corsair curse quest.

Captain Barnaby also offers rides to Brimhaven and Ardougne for 30 coins

Farming patch[edit | edit source]

There is a bush farming patch north-west of the village which can be used by members for farming.

Water source[edit | edit source]

A well is in the centre of the village which can be used as a water source.

Anja and Hengel's house[edit | edit source]

A cooking range is on the ground floor[UK]1st floor[US] as well as a bronze pickaxe that respawns on a table. The 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] contains a bronze scimitar that respawns on a table and Anja and Hengel. Players can ask Anja for some coins, though they must go through a long dialogue to do so.

Rimmington mine[edit | edit source]

The Rimmington mine is north-east of the village. It is a small mine which normally has low level miners, as the mine contains tin, clay, iron, copper, and two gold rocks.

Crafting Guild[edit | edit source]

The Crafting Guild is north-west of Rimmington. However, players require a Crafting level of 40 to enter the guild.

House portal[edit | edit source]

Players starting Construction can visit their house in Rimmington. To buy a house, however, they must visit an estate agent in any of the following cities: Varrock, Falador, Seers' Village, or East Ardougne. A portal found north of Rimmington can be used to go to their house.

Banknote exchange merchant[edit | edit source]

Phials the NPC is located in the general store. His close proximity to the Rimmington house portal makes him a fast way to train Prayer by having him unnote bones.

Melzar's Maze[edit | edit source]

There is a building north-west of the village known as "Melzar's Maze". It is a fairly large dungeon that can only be entered with a key obtained during the Dragon Slayer I quest.

{{*}} [[Long Way Home]] (Classic mode) |map = {{Map|name=Rimmington|x=2956|y=3232}} }} {{Relativelocation |location = Rimmington |north = Falador |east = Port Sarim |south = Karamja |west = Crandor }} '''Rimmington''' is a village in south-west [[Asgarnia]]. It is a very small village, but popular for use of the [[player-owned house]] portal and [[Phials]] for training [[Prayer]]. ==Transportation== There are several ways to reach Rimmington: *Walking south from [[Falador]], or walking west from [[Port Sarim]]. *Casting [[Teleport To House]] if the [[player-owned house]] is in Rimmington. *A [[skills necklace]] can be used to teleport to the nearby [[Crafting Guild]]. *The [[fairy ring]] to the south on [[Mudskipper Point]], {{fairycode|AIQ}}. *The ship from [[Corsair Cove]], available after starting [[The Corsair Curse]] quest. *The ship from [[Ardougne]] and [[Brimhaven]], costing 30 coins (halved by [[Ring of Charos (a)]] and completing [[Cabin Fever]]). ==Stores== ===Rimmington General Store=== {{Main|Rimmington General Store}} The [[general store]] ([[File:General store icon.png]]) has two floors. On the main floor is the shop keeper and the shop assistant. The store rarely has anything of value in it, mainly [[willow logs]] and low level [[items]]. Since Rimmington is so far away from a [[bank]], players rarely sell items to the store. There is nothing other than decorations on the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}}. ===Rommik's Crafty Supplies=== {{Main|Rommik's Crafty Supplies}} [[Rommik's Crafty Supplies]] [[File:Crafting shop icon.png]] is located south of the [[Rimmington General Store]]. [[Rommik]] sells supplies useful for [[crafting]]. His store is exactly the same as the crafting store in [[Al Kharid]]. Players can purchase [[chisel]]s, [[ring mould]]s, [[necklace mould]]s, [[amulet mould]]s, [[needle]]s, [[thread]], [[holy mould]]s, and [[tiara mould]]s from him. ===Brian's Archery Supplies=== {{Main|Brian's Archery Supplies}} [[Brian's Archery Supplies]] ([[File:Archery shop icon.png]]) is located east of [[Rommik]]'s store. [[Brian (Rimmington)|Brian]] sells supplies used for [[Ranged|ranging]]. His store is very similar to [[Lowe's Archery Emporium]] (located in [[Varrock]]), though is much less busy. Players can purchase [[steel arrow]]s, [[mithril arrow]]s, [[adamant arrow]]s, [[oak shortbow]]s, [[oak longbow]]s, [[willow shortbow]]s, [[willow longbow]]s, [[maple shortbow]]s, and [[maple longbow]]s from him, however he doesn't sell [[bronze arrow]]s because they spawn reasonably fast nearby. Two [[logs]] and a bronze arrow [[item spawn|respawn]] on a nearby table in his building. There are also [[rat]]s in his house which can be killed for [[rat's tail]]s for the [[Witch's Potion]] [[quest]]. ==Trees== Rimmington has four [[yew]] trees ([[File:Rare trees icon.png]]) north-west of the [[general store]]. Behind [[Brian (Rimmington)|Brian]]'s and [[Rommik]]'s stores are many [[willow]] trees. There are also some [[oak]] trees to the east of the village. A [[bank]] is very far away, so few players cut these trees. It may be used as a place to level up [[Firemaking]] by cutting a full [[inventory]] of logs and subsequently burning them. However, there is no space to burn a full inventory of logs in a straight line, hampering training efficiency. ==Quests== Rimmington is the start point of only one quest, which is [[free-to-play]]: * [[Witch's Potion]] {{SCP|Quest}} starts in the small house east of [[Brian's Archery Supplies]] where [[Hetty]] lives. ==Features== ===Western jetty=== Players may travel to the [[Corsair Cove]] to talking to [[Cabin Boy Colin]] located on the north ship, after the [[Corsair curse]] quest. [[Captain Barnaby]] also offers rides to [[Brimhaven]] and [[Ardougne]] for 30 coins ===Farming patch=== There is a bush [[Farming/Patch locations|farming patch]] [[File:Farming patch icon.png]] north-west of the village which can be used by [[members]] for [[farming]]. ===Water source=== A well [[File:Water source icon.png]] is in the centre of the village which can be used as a [[water source]]. ===Anja and Hengel's house=== A cooking [[range]] [[File:Cooking range icon.png]] is on the {{FloorNumber|uk=0}} as well as a [[bronze pickaxe]] that [[item spawn|respawns]] on a table. The {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} contains a [[bronze scimitar]] that respawns on a table and [[Anja]] and [[Hengel]]. Players can ask Anja for some [[coins]], though they must go through a long dialogue to do so. ===Rimmington mine=== The [[Rimmington mine]] [[File:Mining site icon.png]] is north-east of the village. It is a small [[Mines|mine]] which normally has low level miners, as the mine contains [[Tin rock|tin]], [[Clay rock|clay]], [[Iron rock|iron]], [[Copper rock|copper]], and two [[gold rock]]s. ===Crafting Guild=== The [[Crafting Guild]] is north-west of Rimmington. However, players require a [[Crafting]] level of 40 to enter the guild. ===House portal=== Players starting [[Construction]] can visit their [[Player-owned house|house]] in Rimmington. To buy a house, however, they must visit an [[estate agent]] in any of the following cities: [[Varrock]], [[Falador]], [[Seers' Village]], or [[East Ardougne]]. A [[POH portal|portal]] [[File:House portal icon.png]] found north of Rimmington can be used to go to their house. ===Banknote exchange merchant=== [[Phials]] the [[Non-player character|NPC]] is located in the [[general store]]. His close proximity to the Rimmington house portal makes him a fast way to train [[Prayer]] by having him unnote [[bones]]. ===Melzar's Maze=== There is a building north-west of the village known as "[[Melzar's Maze]]". It is a fairly large [[List of dungeons|dungeon]] that can only be entered with a key obtained during the [[Dragon Slayer I]] [[Quests|quest]]. {{Biohazard}} {{Regicide}} {{Rimmington}} [[Category:Asgarnia]] [[Category:POH Locations]]
